page_content.BMR OBSERVATION: During the review of batch manufacturing record for Product: Paracetamol Infusion IP 1% W/V (PARAUNIPORT) 100 mL, it is observed that the "Dispensing label of Material Code No .: PMI-0998, A.R. Number 24004242 was found slightly torn".
JUSTIFICATION: > Dispensing process for Product: Paracetamol Infusion IP 1% W/V (PARAUNIPORT) 100 mL, Batch No .: AH250076 was performed on date 02-May-25.
> During the review of the BMR, it was observed that the "Dispensing label of Material Code No .: PMI-0998, A.R. Number 24004242 was found slightly torn".
> PMI-0998 (A.R. Number 24004242): Polypropylene Film APP114-S-135-200-F.were dispensed by Gaurang Trivedi (Employee Code: 341790).
> During material dispensing, production personnel Mr. Salin Patel (Employee Code: 341239) verified the materials on 02-May-25 and recorded the details, then attached the dispensed labels to the BMR.

> While attempting to paste the dispensing label into the BMR Mr. Salin Patel inadvertently torn the label while peeling off label back paper (back-liner). Despite this, the same label was affixed to the BMR.
> As corrective action, the label will be reprinted from the BLPS and attached to the BMR.
> We have verified the BLPS system and confirmed that the PMI-0998 (A.R. Number: 24004242) material dispensing label generated during the process.

> The observed discrepancies pertain to the mishandling of the dispensing label while pasting it into the BMR No. material-related discrepancies were found and the reprinted label will be attached to the BMR along with the torn label. Therefore, there is no impact.

Number 24004242): Polypropylene Film APP114-S-135-200-F.were dispensed by Gaurang Trivedi (Employee Code: 341790). \> During material dispensing, production personnel Mr. Salin Patel (Employee Code: 341239) verified the materials on 02-May-25 and recorded the details, then attached the dispensed labels to the BMR. \> While attempting to paste the dispensing label into the BMR Mr. Salin Patel inadvertently torn the label while peeling off label back paper (back-liner). Despite this, the same label was affixed to the BMR \> As corrective action, the label will be reprinted from the BLPS and attached to the BMR. \> We have verified the BLPS system and confirmed that the PMI-0998 (A.R. Number: 24004242) material dispensing label generated during the process. \> The observed discrepancies pertain to the mishandling of the dispensing label while pasting it into the BMR No. material-related discrepancies were found and the reprinted label will be attached to the BMR along with the torn label. Therefore, there is no impact.
